template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the {industry} domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic end-to-end operational workflow in the manufacturing domain that would require coordinating multiple tools, resolving at least one constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome; output only the prompt text and keep it under 40 words.

message.content: When a defective part halts assembly, locate a replacement in inventory, update the quality log and stock system, then resume production to complete the order.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, let's look at what the user is asking. They want a single-sentence prompt in plain English for a manufacturing workflow. The prompt needs to describe an end-to-end operation involving multiple tools, resolving a constraint, updating systems, and delivering a final outcome. Also, it has to be under 40 words.

First, I need to make sure I understand all the requirements. "End-to-end operational workflow" means covering everything from start to finish in a manufacturing process. "Coordinating multiple tools" suggests using different systems or equipment. "Resolving at least one constraint" could be something like a material shortage or scheduling conflict. "Updating systems" implies that once the constraint is resolved, databases or records need to be updated. "Final outcome" is the end product or result.

I should brainstorm a realistic scenario. Maybe something like handling a defective part in an assembly line. That would involve detecting the issue, checking inventory for a replacement, coordinating with quality control, updating inventory systems, and ensuring the final product meets specifications. 

Wait, the user specified "under 40 words." So the sentence has to be concise. Let me draft a few options. 

Option 1: "When a defective part halts assembly, locate a replacement in inventory, update the quality log and stock system, then resume production to complete the order." That's 25 words. Checks the boxes: multiple tools (inventory system, quality log), constraint (defective part), updating systems (stock system), final outcome (complete the order).

Option 2: "After a machine breakdown, reschedule the maintenance, adjust the production plan, update the ERP system, and ship the delayed batch once repaired." That's also around 25 words. Constraint here is the machine breakdown, tools include scheduling and ERP systems, outcome is shipping the batch.

Which one is more realistic? Both work, but the first one might be more common in manufacturing. Let's count the words in Option 1: 25 exactly. That's under 40. It includes coordinating tools (inventory, quality log), resolving the defective part constraint, updating stock system, and delivering the completed order. Yeah, that fits.

Make sure it's a single sentence. Yep, it is. Plain English, no jargon. Okay, that should work.
